intro: Entolasia whiteana, commonly known as the white-flowered entolasia, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its showy, white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are typically alternate, ovate, and covered in fine hairs. Entolasia whiteana is often found in wetland or marshy habitats, where it thrives in moist, nutrient-rich soils.
